intro: Alsine sinaica, commonly known as the Sinai sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Sinai Peninsula. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically fleshy and adapted to conserve water in harsh desert conditions. Alsine sinaica plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
